fever.Medicine:
- Paracetamol 500 mg: Every 6 hours for fever
- Ibuprofen 400 mg: Alternative if no contraindications
fever.Alternative:
- Cold compress on forehead
- Sponge bath with lukewarm water
fever.Lifestyle: Hydration (8-10 glasses water), rest, light diet, avoid cold beverages.
fever.Red Flags: Fever >3 days, severe headache, rash, difficulty breathing, confusion.
fever.Follow-Up: Review in 48 hours if fever persists or worsens.

diabetes.Medicine:
- Metformin 500 mg: BD with meals
- Glimepiride 1 mg: OD before breakfast (if needed)
diabetes.Alternative:
- DPP-4 inhibitors (Sitagliptin) if metformin not tolerated
- Insulin therapy for uncontrolled cases
diabetes.Lifestyle: Low glycemic diet, regular exercise (30 min daily), monitor blood glucose, weight management.
diabetes.Red Flags: Glucose >400 mg/dL, confusion, chest pain, excessive thirst, diabetic ketoacidosis signs.
diabetes.Follow-Up: HbA1c every 3 months, fasting glucose weekly, regular eye and foot checks.

cold.Medicine:
- Cetirizine 10 mg: Once daily for runny nose
- Paracetamol 500 mg: For fever/body ache
- Cough syrup: As needed
cold.Alternative:
- Steam inhalation 3x daily
- Ginger-honey tea
- Saline nasal drops
cold.Lifestyle: Rest, hydration, warm fluids, avoid cold beverages, vitamin C rich foods.
cold.Red Flags: High fever, chest pain, difficulty breathing, symptoms >7 days.
cold.Follow-Up: Review if symptoms persist beyond 5 days or worsen.

headache.Medicine:
- Paracetamol 500 mg: Every 6-8 hours as needed
- For migraine: Sumatriptan 50 mg at onset
headache.Alternative:
- Ibuprofen 400 mg
- Cold/warm compress
- Rest in dark quiet room
headache.Lifestyle: Stress management, regular sleep schedule, hydration, avoid triggers (caffeine, bright lights).
headache.Red Flags: Sudden severe headache (thunderclap), vision changes, confusion, neck stiffness, seizures.
headache.Follow-Up: Review if headaches increase in frequency or severity. Consider CT/MRI if red flags present.

hypertension.Medicine:
- Amlodipine 5 mg: Once daily
- Losartan 50 mg: Once daily (if needed)
- Aspirin 75 mg: For cardiovascular protection
hypertension.Alternative:
- Beta-blockers (Metoprolol) if tachycardia present
- Diuretics (Hydrochlorothiazide) for fluid retention
hypertension.Lifestyle: Low salt diet (<5g/day), DASH diet, regular exercise, stress reduction, weight loss, limit alcohol.
hypertension.Red Flags: BP >180/120, severe headache, chest pain, shortness of breath, visual changes.
hypertension.Follow-Up: BP monitoring weekly, review medication in 4 weeks, annual cardiac assessment.

asthma.Medicine:
- Salbutamol inhaler: 2 puffs PRN for breathlessness
- Beclomethasone inhaler: 2 puffs BD (controller)
asthma.Alternative:
- Montelukast 10 mg: Once daily
- Nebulization with salbutamol in acute attack
asthma.Lifestyle: Avoid triggers (dust, smoke, allergens), regular inhaler use, breathing exercises.
asthma.Red Flags: Severe breathlessness, unable to speak, blue lips, no response to inhaler.
asthma.Follow-Up: Peak flow monitoring, review in 2 weeks, pulmonary function tests annually.

gastric.Medicine:
- Pantoprazole 40 mg: Once daily before breakfast
- Antacids: As needed for immediate relief
gastric.Alternative:
- Ranitidine 150 mg: BD if PPI not tolerated
- Sucralfate for mucosal protection
gastric.Lifestyle: Small frequent meals, avoid spicy/oily foods, no late night meals, reduce stress, avoid NSAIDs.
gastric.Red Flags: Severe abdominal pain, vomiting blood, black stools, unexplained weight loss.
gastric.Follow-Up: Review in 4 weeks. Consider endoscopy if symptoms persist or red flags present.

allergy.Medicine:
- Cetirizine 10 mg: Once daily
- Hydrocortisone cream: For skin rash BD
- In severe reaction: Epinephrine auto-injector
allergy.Alternative:
- Loratadine 10 mg if cetirizine causes drowsiness
- Calamine lotion for itching
allergy.Lifestyle: Identify and avoid allergen, keep antihistamines handy, wear medical alert bracelet if severe.
allergy.Red Flags: Swelling of face/tongue, difficulty breathing, rapid pulse, anaphylaxis.
allergy.Follow-Up: Allergy testing if recurrent. Emergency plan for severe allergies.

arthritis.Medicine:
- Ibuprofen 400 mg: TDS with food
- Glucosamine supplements: For joint health
arthritis.Alternative:
- Paracetamol for mild pain
- Topical NSAIDs (Diclofenac gel)
arthritis.Lifestyle: Regular low-impact exercise (swimming, walking), weight management, physiotherapy, hot/cold therapy.
arthritis.Red Flags: Severe joint swelling, redness, warmth, inability to move joint, fever.
arthritis.Follow-Up: Review in 4-6 weeks. X-ray if severe. Consider rheumatologist referral.

mental_health.Medicine:
- For anxiety: Escitalopram 10 mg OD or Alprazolam 0.25 mg SOS
- For depression: Sertraline 50 mg OD
mental_health.Alternative:
- Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT)
- Mindfulness and meditation
- Support groups
mental_health.Lifestyle: Regular exercise, good sleep hygiene, social support, stress management, avoid alcohol/drugs.
mental_health.Red Flags: Suicidal thoughts, self-harm, severe agitation, psychotic symptoms.
mental_health.Follow-Up: Weekly counseling sessions, medication review in 2 weeks. Psychiatric referral if severe.

general.Medicine:
- Symptomatic treatment based on presentation
- Paracetamol 500 mg: As needed for pain/fever
general.Lifestyle: Healthy diet, adequate rest, hydration, stress management.
general.Red Flags: Persistent symptoms >3 days, worsening condition, new concerning symptoms.
general.Follow-Up: Review in 48-72 hours if no improvement.
